intro: Enosanthes flavescens, commonly known as the yellow sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, often blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Enosanthes flavescens is known for its resilience to arid conditions and its role in supporting local ecosystems.
